Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.service.logging

Class TextualWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Handler
      • java.util.logging.StreamHandler
        • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.service.logging.TextualWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writer, java.io.Serializable
    public final class TextualWriter
extends java.util.logging.StreamHandler
implements Writer
    The TextualWriter defines a textual writer performing its output on a file. Its implementation is based on the Java Logging API.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextualWriter

        public TextualWriter​(java.lang.String p)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        p - the logging directory path. If the path is relative, then the directory path has as initial part the path of the logging repository. This writer uses the default textual formatter.
        See Also:
        TextualFormatter

      • TextualWriter

        public TextualWriter​(java.lang.String p,
                     java.util.logging.Formatter f)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        p - the logging directory path. if the path is relative, then the directory path has as initial part the path of the logging repository.
        f - the logging data formatter.
